column1: Image:Vala.gifIn its singular form the word vala is also the name in Quenya of the twenty-second letter of the Tengwar alphabet.
column3: The names of the letters  It is the second letter of the sixth grade or Tyellë
column4: which contains "semi-vocalic" consonants and it is the sixth letter in the labial or p-series of consonants
column6: since Ampa (letter 14) is used for MP
column7: Vala is used for V.  In other modes (where Ampa is used for V) Vala represents W.  However
column8: in the Mode of Beleriand this letter represents M.
column9: footnote 2  The Westron name for this letter is Wí.See Westron Tengwar
